chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Crist Pelot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
If the defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of Extended Supervision shall remain the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $8,970.37 and restitution surcharge. Joint and several with co-actor Chase Hippert.
----------------------------------------------

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
----------------------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with co-defendants. No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
----------------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
----------------------------------------------

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before 11/21/2016 at 8:00 a.m. and with work releases privileges.
Complete 100 hours of community service work during the period of probation ordered WITHOUT buyout option.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: BOND QUASHED

10:02 am  Court in session.  Case Called.  Appearances given.  
Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft David J. Crist Pelot in court with Atty Michael Fitzsimmons.  
Matter is before the Court today for sentencing hearing.  Deft plead guilty to all 4 counts in the Information.  There is a joint recommendation for sentence except as to whether there should be conditional jail time and whether there should be special disposition under 973.015.  Court has reviewed the victim impact statement that is on file and has reviewed the victim restitution request form.  Atty Leusink makes record with regard to victim notification.  
10:04 am  Argument as to sentence by Attorney Leusink.  
10:08 am  Argument by Atty Flitcroft.  
10:15 am  Statement by defendant.  Response by Deft to Court's questions.  
10:21 am  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  Court will not grant special disposition.  

SENTENCE:  
Count #1:  
1 yr IC and 1 yr ES for total lengh of sentence of 2 yrs - STAYED;  Three (3) years probation;  Deft found eligible for CIP and SAP;  

Counts #2, #3, #4:  
Withheld sentence, Two (2) years probation;  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
1)  On Ct #1:  Thirty (30) days in Jail w/work release privileges to commence on or before 11/21/2016;  
2)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
3)  No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
4)  Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  
5)  No contact with victim without victim's and Probation Agent's consent.  
6)  No contact with co-defendants.  
7)  Possess no weapons.  
8)  Complete 100 hours of community service work.  
9)  Pay restitution in the amount of $8,970.37 - joint and several with co-actor Chase Hippert.  
10)  Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
11)  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  
Court gives warnings with regard to firearm restriction and voting ineligibility.  10:34 am  Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing on September 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Background Information Form (BIF)

Defendant David J. Crist Pelot in court with attorney Michael John Fitzsimmons.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Final pre-trial on August 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David J. Crist Pelot in court with attorney Michael John Fitzsimmons.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David J. Crist Pelot in court with attorney Michael John Fitzsimmons.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant David J. Crist Pelot in court with attorney Michael J. Fitzsimmons.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Atty Michael Fitzsimmons
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH WAL-MART IN WHITEWATER OR WITH D.H. OR A.K. OR P.D.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CHASE HIPPERT.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant David J. Crist Pelot appeared, Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
